info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 4:01PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Warren, northeastern Berks, central Lehigh and central Northampton Counties through 430 PM EDT... At 401 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Beersville to near Fairview Hgts. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Allentown, Easton, Bethlehem, Forks, Emmaus, Northampton, Wilson, Nazareth, Kutztown, Fleetwood, Bath, Belvidere, Harmony, Oxford, Topton, Leesport, Belfast, Shoemakersville, West Easton and Tatamy. This includes the following highways... Northeast Extension between mile markers 52 and 66. Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 38 and 60. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
